column1: During your visits, will: - Weigh you - Measure your abdomen to see if your baby is growing as expected - Check your blood pressure - Take a urine sample to test for protein in your urine, if you have high blood pressure Your doctor or midwife may also give you a pelvic exam to see if your cervix is dilating.
As you get closer to your due date, and your baby grows bigger, you should notice a different pattern of movement than earlier in your pregnancy.
